CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Significant progress has been made in synthesis of conjugated polymers and their applications for optoelectronic device such as organic light - emitting diodes ( OLEDs ) , organic photovoltaic cells ( OPVs ) , and organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) since Heeger , MacDiarmid , and Shirakawa discovered conducting polymers in 1976.^1 As a result of the low - cost , light - weight , and flexibility advantages , optoelectronic devices based on conjugated polymers are a promising cost - effective alternative to inorganic materials - based microelectronics. Conjugated polymers can be classified as hole ( p - type ) or electron ( n - type ) transporting materials according to the type of orderly transferring charge carriers. Most of conjugated polymers are p - type semiconductors that have seen a dramatic rise in performance over the past decade while much less attention has been devoted to n - type semiconducting polymers that have lagged behind their p - type counterparts. 2 Organic n - type materials are essential for the fabrication of organic p-n junctions , OPVs , n-channel OFETs , OLEDs , and complementary logic circuits. 3 The n - type building blocks are the core components in n - type semiconducting polymers. Aromatic imides such as rylene diimides are one of the classical n - type building blocks and can exhibit relatively high electron affinities , high electron mobilities , and excellent chemical , thermal , and photochemical stabilities. 4 These materials are electron deficient due to the substitution of an aromatic core with one or two sets of π-accepting imide groups that are mutually conjugated. The widely used rylene diimides include perylene diimides ( PDIs , 1 ) and naphthalene diimides ( NDIs , 2 ) ( Figure 1 ). Zhan and co-workers reported the synthesis of the first soluble rylene-based fully conjugated polymer. 5 Top-gate OFETs based on this PDI- dithienothiophene copolymer exhibited a saturation electron mobility ( μ e ) of 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , current on / off ratio ( I on / I off ) of 10^4 , and a low threshold voltage ( V th ) of 7 V in air. 6 Moreover , all - polymer solar cells based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors exhibited power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 1.5% ( AM1.5 , 100 mW cm^-2 ). 7-9 Facchetti et al. reported a conjugated copolymer of NDI and bithiophene ; 10 OFET devices based on this polymer fabricated in a top-gate , bottom - contact configuration with polymeric dielectrics exhibited μ e of 0.1-0.85 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions with I on / I off > 10^5 . 11 The simplest aromatic imide system is phthalimide ( 3 ) and thiophene imide ( 4 ) ( Figure 1 ). A few literatures reported phthalimide - containing conjugated polymers such as poly-(phenylene ethynylene)s , 12 a polyaniline derivative , 13 and a polythiophene derivative.

Let's think step by step.

1. conjugated polymers
2. inorganic materials - based microelectronics
3. p - type semiconductors
4. n - type semiconducting polymers
5. aromatic imides such as rylene diimides
6. π-accepting imide groups
7. perylene diimides (PDIs)
8. naphthalene diimides (NDIs)
9. PDI- dithienothiophene copolymer
10. polythiophene derivative donors
11. aromatic imide system (phthalimide)
12. thiophene imide
13. polyaniline derivative
14. polythiophene derivative.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. conjugated polymers
2. inorganic materials
3. p-type semiconductors
4. n-type semiconducting polymers
5. aromatic imides
6. rylene diimides
7. perylene diimides (PDIs)
8. naphthalene diimides (NDIs)
9. PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer
10. polythiophene derivative
11. phthalimide
12. thiophene imide
13. polyaniline derivative
14. polythiophene derivative

Note: I have removed "inorganic materials-based microelectronics" as it is not a material name but a type of material. Also, I have removed "π-accepting imide groups" and "polythiophene derivative donors" as they are not material names but rather a property of a material and a type of material respectively.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| conjugated polymers |
| inorganic materials |
| p-type semiconductors |
| n-type semiconducting polymers |
| aromatic imides |
| rylene diimides |
| perylene diimides (PDIs) |
| naphthalene diimides (NDIs) |
| PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer |

| phthalimide |
| thiophene imide |
| polyaniline derivative |
| polythiophene derivative |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Significant progress has been made in synthesis of conjugated polymers and their applications for optoelectronic device such as organic light - emitting diodes ( OLEDs ) , organic photovoltaic cells ( OPVs ) , and organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) since Heeger , MacDiarmid , and Shirakawa discovered conducting polymers in 1976.^1 As a result of the low - cost , light - weight , and flexibility advantages , optoelectronic devices based on conjugated polymers are a promising cost - effective alternative to inorganic materials - based microelectronics. Conjugated polymers can be classified as hole ( p - type ) or electron ( n - type ) transporting materials according to the type of orderly transferring charge carriers. Most of conjugated polymers are p - type semiconductors that have seen a dramatic rise in performance over the past decade while much less attention has been devoted to n - type semiconducting polymers that have lagged behind their p - type counterparts. 2 Organic n - type materials are essential for the fabrication of organic p-n junctions , OPVs , n-channel OFETs , OLEDs , and complementary logic circuits. 3 The n - type building blocks are the core components in n - type semiconducting polymers. Aromatic imides such as rylene diimides are one of the classical n - type building blocks and can exhibit relatively high electron affinities , high electron mobilities , and excellent chemical , thermal , and photochemical stabilities. 4 These materials are electron deficient due to the substitution of an aromatic core with one or two sets of π-accepting imide groups that are mutually conjugated. The widely used rylene diimides include perylene diimides ( PDIs , 1 ) and naphthalene diimides ( NDIs , 2 ) ( Figure 1 ). Zhan and co-workers reported the synthesis of the first soluble rylene-based fully conjugated polymer. 5 Top-gate OFETs based on this PDI- dithienothiophene copolymer exhibited a saturation electron mobility ( μ e ) of 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , current on / off ratio ( I on / I off ) of 10^4 , and a low threshold voltage ( V th ) of 7 V in air. 6 Moreover , all - polymer solar cells based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors exhibited power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 1.5% ( AM1.5 , 100 mW cm^-2 ). 7-9 Facchetti et al. reported a conjugated copolymer of NDI and bithiophene ; 10 OFET devices based on this polymer fabricated in a top-gate , bottom - contact configuration with polymeric dielectrics exhibited μ e of 0.1-0.85 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions with I on / I off > 10^5 . 11 The simplest aromatic imide system is phthalimide ( 3 ) and thiophene imide ( 4 ) ( Figure 1 ). A few literatures reported phthalimide - containing conjugated polymers such as poly-(phenylene ethynylene)s , 12 a polyaniline derivative , 13 and a polythiophene derivative.

Let's think step by step.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Conjugated polymers have seen a dramatic rise in performance over the past decade.
2. Most of conjugated polymers are p-type semiconductors.
3. Organic n-type materials are essential for the fabrication of organic p-n junctions, OPVs, n-channel OFETs, OLEDs, and complementary logic circuits.
4. Aromatic imides such as rylene diimides can exhibit relatively high electron affinities, high electron mobilities, and excellent chemical, thermal, and photochemical stabilities.
5. Top-gate OFETs based on a PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer exhibited a saturation electron mobility (μe) of 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1.
6. All-polymer solar cells based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors exhibited power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) as high as 1.5% (AM1.5, 100 mW cm^-2).
7. OFET devices based on a conjugated copolymer of NDI and bithiophene exhibited μe of 0.1-0.85 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions.
8. The simplest aromatic imide system is phthalimide (3) and thiophene imide (4).
9. A few literatures reported phthalimide-containing conjugated polymers such as poly-(phenylene ethynylene)s.

Values of material properties in the text are:

1. High performance in conjugated polymers
2. p-type for most conjugated polymers
3. Essential for organic p-n junctions, OPVs, n-channel OFETs, OLEDs, and complementary logic circuits
4. High electron affinities, high electron mobilities, excellent chemical, thermal, and photochemical stabilities for aromatic imides
5. Saturation electron mobility (μe) of 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 for PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer
6. Power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) as high as 1.5% (AM1.5, 100 mW cm^-2) for all-polymer solar cells
7. μe of 0.1-0.85 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions for a conjugated copolymer of NDI and bithiophene
8. Phthalimide (3) and thiophene imide (4) are the simplest aromatic imide system.
9. Phthalimide-containing conjugated polymers such as poly-(phenylene ethynylene)s.

| Phthalimide (3) and thiophene imide (4) are the simplest aromatic imide system. |
